XPathResult.summary: The XPathResult interface represents the results generated by evaluating an XPath expression within the context of a given node.

remarks.para: Since XPath expressions can result in a variety of result types, this interface makes it possible to determine and handle the type and value of the result.

XPathResultBooleanValue.summary:
The read-only booleanValue property of the
interface returns the boolean value of a result with
being BOOLEAN_TYPE.
XPathResultBooleanValue.value:
The return value is the boolean value of the XPathResult returned by
.

XPathResultInvalidIteratorState.summary:
The read-only invalidIteratorState property of the
interface signifies that the iterator has become invalid. It
is true if is
UNORDERED_NODE_ITERATOR_TYPE or ORDERED_NODE_ITERATOR_TYPE and
the document has been modified since this result was returned.
XPathResultInvalidIteratorState.value: A boolean value indicating whether the iterator has become invalid.

XPathResultIterateNext.summary:
The iterateNext() method of the
interface iterates over a node set result and returns the
next node from it or null if there are no more nodes.
XPathResultIterateNext.returns: The next within the node set of the XPathResult.

XPathResultNumberValue.summary:
The read-only numberValue property of the
interface returns the numeric value of a result with
being NUMBER_TYPE.
XPathResultNumberValue.value:
The return value is the numeric value of the XPathResult returned by
.

XPathResultResultType.summary:
The read-only resultType property of the
interface represents the type of the result, as defined by
the type constants.
XPathResultResultType.value: An integer value representing the type of the result, as defined by the type constants.

XPathResultSingleNodeValue.summary:
The read-only singleNodeValue property of the
interface returns a value or
null in case no node was matched of a result with
being ANY_UNORDERED_NODE_TYPE or
FIRST_ORDERED_NODE_TYPE.
XPathResultSingleNodeValue.value:
The return value is the value of the XPathResult
returned by .

XPathResultSnapshotItem.summary:
The snapshotItem() method of the
interface returns an item of the snapshot collection or
null in case the index is not within the range of nodes. Unlike the
iterator result, the snapshot does not become invalid, but may not correspond to the
current document if it is mutated.
XPathResultSnapshotItem.returns:
The at the given index within the node set of the
XPathResult.

XPathResultSnapshotLength.summary:
The read-only snapshotLength property of the
interface represents the number of nodes in the result
snapshot.
XPathResultSnapshotLength.value: An integer value representing the number of nodes in the result snapshot.

XPathResultStringValue.summary:
The read-only stringValue property of the
interface returns the string value of a result with
being STRING_TYPE.
XPathResultStringValue.value:
The return value is the string value of the XPathResult returned by
.
